page.title: 08BOWMAN'S FARM:TEST VALLEY
page.content: In contrast to the large Broadlands Farm we studied Bowman's Farm.The owner rents the farm from Broadlands Estate but farms it himself,with his wife and a casual worker. It is 70 acres,and the fields are quite small,varying between 2 and 10 hectares and separated by hedgerows which are rich in wildlife.Most of the land is flat,but even though it is on the banks of the river,it is not marshy.Most of the soil is clay,with a little gravel.It requires potash fertilizers. It is a mixed farm.Cereals,such as wheat,grass for hay and silage,and market gardening crops are grown.The crops are used to feed the beef cattle reared on the farm.These are Friesians crossed with Herefords.Hens are kept on the farm too.
